sentence.Network_en: He slipped and fell on an airplane gangway as the cameras rolled.
sentence.Network_cn: 在摄像时他不慎滑倒在飞机座位间的通道上。

sentence.Network_en: A man in the gangway suddenly stood up to reach for something in the overhead locker.
sentence.Network_cn: 靠通道坐的一名男子突然起身去拿头顶上方行李舱里的什么东西。

sentence.Network_en: Walking along the narrow gangway of the theater, I see a familiar face.
sentence.Network_cn: 走在剧场里狭窄的过道上时我看到了一张熟悉的面孔.

entry.def: A gangway is the same as a gangplank .

entry.tran: （剧场、飞机等的）座间通道，过道
entry.def: The gangway is the passage between rows of seats, for example in a theatre or aircraft, for people to walk along.

example.ex: A man in the gangway suddenly stood up to reach for something in the overhead locker.
example.tran: 靠通道坐的一名男子突然起身去拿头顶上方行李舱里的什么东西。

means.word_mean: 1. a temporary passageway of planks (as over mud on a building site)
2. a temporary bridge for getting on and off a vessel at dockside
3. passageway between seating areas as in an auditorium or passenger vehicle or between areas of shelves of goods as in stores

auth_sentence.content: I also need a seat where I can extend my leg into the gangway.
auth_sentence.res_content: I also need a seat where I can extend my leg into the gangway.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I also need a seat where I can extend my leg into the gangway.

means.word_mean: <英>(剧场等)座位间的过道,通道

sentences.en: Walking along the narrow gangway of the theater, I see a familiar face.
sentences.cn: 走在剧场里狭窄的过道上时我看到了一张熟悉的面孔。
